xhaustion and some moderate burn

ks in his armor, and that's his damaged

>
> Per=
haps the power he had extended outward, was in vain. Tucson lies on the
> g=
round for a moment or so, but slowly rolls back up onto his left side,
> ho=
lding up his upper body with his arms which shake under the sheer pressure
=
> of his weight. He looks around, and finds Darkhawk, severely weakened by =
the
> powerful blast. Night Shift wastes no time in slapping a pair of stas=
is
> cuffs on Darkhawk, who in reality was Windlord.
>
> "Gotchya. Don't wo=
rry, you're in good hands now. Yo, Kup! Better take this
> guy for me, I th=
ink Tucson Prime's commn' around."
>
> Tucson calmly looks around yet with =
a stern expression on his face.
>
> "Not - the result I was hoping for but =
- it did enable us to get somewhere.
> Can't - have it all I suppose, but d=
oesn't mean we're giving up all
> together."
>
> Slowly he makes it onto hi=
s knees, and then plants one foot down on the
> ground, hoisting himself up=
 to his feet, with a bit of a stumble. He was
> weak, extremely weak, and i=
t was questionable wether or not he would be able
> to continue fighting. H=
e didn't want anyone to see him in such a condition
> though. He fights his=
 weakness and tries to shrug off the grogginess he
> feels. Night Shift nod=
ds in agreement with Tucson Prime.
>
> " I hear ya on that one big bot. Som=
etimes, ya win some, ya lose some, and
> sometimes it's kinda like in the m=
iddle of both losn' and winn'n."
>
> Tucson understood that the mission its=
elf would be difficult so he prepared
> himself for the unexpected by worki=
ng with that uncertainty that plans don't
> always go as they are intended.=
 He shrugs off the fact that Cyclonus is not
> even scathed by the energy a=
ttack. He was now curious about Rodimus and how
> he had handled it.
>
> " =
Something - Rodimus wasn't too good at doing. I have a feeling he may not
>=
 have taken this too well, Nightshift."
>
> Nightshift narrows his optics.
=
>
> " Lemme tell ya somethn' Tucson, before you became a Prime, and he was =
on
> the job, it didn't look like his spark was totally in his work. But yo=
u, the
> quiet guy in the corner, the guy who threw caution ta the wind ta =
save his
> comrades, the guy who faces adversity as it comes and ain't afra=
id of it,
> and the guy who actually learned from his loss rather than comp=
lain'n about
> it. You got what it takes, and always had it. It - just wasn=
't obvious
> because you're too modest for your own good and you kinda just=
 kept ta
> yourself most of the time."
>
> Tucson listens thoughtfully to N=
ightshift.
>
> " You're right, I wasn't much for words at the time... But b=
ack then, I
> wanted to approach Rodimus on his not so pleasurable attitude=
 on his
> position as a Prime. It seemed as if he didn't want it. And you k=
now,
> responsibility isn't for everyone. And for some, it's second nature.=
"
>
> Night Shift nodds.
>
> " Understandable. Now I admit, I dunno if I co=
uld ever take your job big
> guy. Not that I ain't capable of it, I know I =
ain't a good match for the
> position. And I ain't afraid ta admit that."
>=

> Tucson Prime nodds once, and studies Cyclonus once more. Something dawns=
 on
> him. He seemed relieved to be free of something.
>
> "Is it me Cyclon=
us or do you appear to be liberated of something that may
> have been holdi=
ng you back? Why do you work with Hydras anyway? What is the
> purpose of w=
orking with him when you can be your own individual? Your life
> should be =
as you intended, and not what others have intended for you. It
> boils down=
 to freedom. You have the chance to experience freedom. If I were
> you I'd=
 take that chance now. As a matter of fact, Scorponok, Scourge, what
> seem=
s to be holding you two back here, when you yourselves can be your own
> in=
dividuals as Decepticons? Does Hydras have you on some sort of leash? I
> s=
ee no such restraints so that means if you want freedom you should also
> t=
ake it."
>
> Night Shift could see what Tucson was up to. It was one of his=
 thinking
> outside the box kind of strategies. And a strategy that would b=
enefit all
> and not just one faction. Tucson was trying to break new groun=
d, and as
> crazy as it all looked, he sits back to watch it all take place=
. Tucson
> Prime now steps asside and waits to see if any of them either tr=
y to destroy
> him, or actually agree with what he was trying to tell them.=

>
> "Whatever any of you chose, your decision is your own and I will not
>=
 interfere. We may not be allies, but I do respect the need for one's free
=
> will. But if you attack me, do not expect me to be so forgiving."

<p>OOC: Tucson collapsed due to extreme exhaus=
tion and some moderate burn 
damages from the magma. Yes, even magma didn&#=
39;t stopp him from trying to help his 
comrades. He's got some burn ma=
rks in his armor, and that's his damaged state 
for now.</p><div><div><=
/div><div class=3D"h5"><br><br>BIC: <br><br>Perhaps the power he had extend=
ed outward, was in 
vain. Tucson lies on the ground for a moment or so, but=
 slowly rolls back up 
onto his left side, holding up his upper body with h=
is arms which shake under 
the sheer pressure of his weight. He looks aroun=
d, and finds Darkhawk, severely 
weakened by the powerful blast. Night Shif=
t wastes no time in slapping a pair of 
stasis cuffs on Darkhawk, who in re=
ality was Windlord.<br><br>"Gotchya. Don't 
worry, you're in g=
ood hands now. Yo, Kup! Better take this guy for me, I think 
Tucson Prime&=
#39;s commn' around."<br><br>Tucson calmly looks around yet with a=
 
stern expression on his face.<br><br>"Not - the result I was hoping =
for but - it 
did enable us to get somewhere. Can't - have it all I sup=
pose, but doesn't mean 
we're giving up all together."<br><br>=
Slowly he makes it onto his knees, and 
then plants one foot down on the gr=
ound, hoisting himself up to his feet, with a 
bit of a stumble. He was wea=
k, extremely weak, and it was questionable wether or 
not he would be able =
to continue fighting. He didn't want anyone to see him in 
such a condi=
tion though. He fights his weakness and tries to shrug off the 
grogginess =
he feels. Night Shift nodds in agreement with Tucson Prime. <br><br>" =

I hear ya on that one big bot. Sometimes, ya win some, ya lose some, and 
=
sometimes it's kinda like in the middle of both losn' and winn'=
n."<br><br>Tucson 
understood that the mission itself would be difficu=
lt so he prepared himself for 
the unexpected by working with that uncertai=
nty that plans don't always go as 
they are intended. He shrugs off the=
 fact that Cyclonus is not even scathed by 
the energy attack. He was now c=
urious about Rodimus and how he had handled it. 
<br><br>" Something -=
 Rodimus wasn't too good at doing. I have a feeling he may 
not have ta=
ken this too well, Nightshift."<br><br>Nightshift narrows his 
optics.=
<br><br>" Lemme tell ya somethn' Tucson, before you became a Prime=
, and 
he was on the job, it didn't look like his spark was totally in =
his work. But 
you, the quiet guy in the corner, the guy who threw caution =
ta the wind ta save 
his comrades, the guy who faces adversity as it comes =
and ain't afraid of it, 
and the guy who actually learned from his loss=
 rather than complain'n about it. 
You got what it takes, and always ha=
d it. It - just wasn't obvious because 
you're too modest for your =
own good and you kinda just kept ta yourself most of 
the time."<br><b=
r>Tucson listens thoughtfully to Nightshift.<br><br>" You're 
righ=
t, I wasn't much for words at the time... But back then, I wanted to 
a=
pproach Rodimus on his not so pleasurable attitude on his position as a Pri=
me. 
It seemed as if he didn't want it. And you know, responsibility is=
n't for 
everyone. And for some, it's second nature."<br><br>N=
ight Shift nodds.<br><br>" 
Understandable. Now I admit, I dunno if I =
could ever take your job big guy. Not 
that I ain't capable of it, I kn=
ow I ain't a good match for the position. And I 
ain't afraid ta ad=
mit that."<br><br>Tucson Prime nodds once, and studies 
Cyclonus once =
more. Something dawns on him. He seemed relieved to be free of 
something. =
<br><br>"Is it me Cyclonus or do you appear to be liberated of 
someth=
ing that may have been holding you back? Why do you work with Hydras 
anywa=
y? What is the purpose of working with him when you can be your own 
indivi=
dual? Your life should be as you intended, and not what others have 
intend=
ed for you. It boils down to freedom. You have the chance to experience 
fr=
eedom. If I were you I'd take that chance now. As a matter of fact, Sco=
rponok, 
Scourge, what seems to be holding you two back here, when you your=
selves can be 
your own individuals as Decepticons? Does Hydras have you on=
 some sort of leash? 
I see no such restraints so that means if you want fr=
eedom you should also take 
it."<br><br>Night Shift could see what Tuc=
son was up to. It was one of his 
thinking outside the box kind of strategi=
es. And a strategy that would benefit 
all and not just one faction. Tucson=
 was trying to break new ground, and as 
crazy as it all looked, he sits ba=
ck to watch it all take place. Tucson Prime 
now steps asside and waits to =
see if any of them either try to destroy him, or 
actually agree with what =
he was trying to tell them.<br><br>"Whatever any of you 
chose, your d=
ecision is your own and I will not interfere. We may not be allies, 
but I =
do respect the need for one's free will. But if you attack me, do not
